citations.narrative:
Nine dogs to be housed short-term at the facility and one of the facility's breeding dogs (Viola) did not have tags for official
identification. Official identification such as tags are important for husbandry tracking of animals. Ensure that each dog
has official identification as required.
***Correct by 11/12/2024.

Tags at the facility identify each dog by a unique name, however an identification number that is serially numbered is
required to uniquely identify each dog. Serially numbering each tag helps track animals for husbandry purposes over time.
Ensure to add identification numbers for each tag as required.
***Correct by 12/31/2024.

Nine dogs are being housed at the facility short-term and have not been added to the record of acquisition with the
required information. Up to date records for dogs on hand can be important for animal health tracking purposes. Dogs
acquired in the facility must be added to APHIS 7005 with the required information.
***Correct by 11/9/2024.

Five dogs were observed to be overdue for maintaining unmatted hair coats (dog names Music, Laddy, Cherry, Goldi, and
Viola). The licensee said that haircuts for dogs was programmed for this week, however the dogs had matted hair coats
and need to be maintained free from matted hair coats. Matted hair can cause skin problems and discomfort in dogs.
Ensure to groom affected dogs and adjust the routine of care to prevent matted hair coats.
***Item was corrected prior to delivery of this report (affected dogs had been groomed and facility began to trim hair on
additional unaffected dogs to prevent matting).
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Nine dogs to be housed short-term at the facility and one of the facility's breeding dogs (Viola) did not have tags for official 
identification. Official identification such as tags are important for husbandry tracking of animals. Ensure that each dog 
has official identification as required.  
***Correct by 11/12/2024. 
2.51(c) 
   
Form of official tag. 
Tags at the facility identify each dog by a unique name, however an identification number that is serially numbered is 
required to uniquely identify each dog. Serially numbering each tag helps track animals for husbandry purposes over time. 
Ensure to add identification numbers for each tag as required.  
***Correct by 12/31/2024. 
2.75 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Nine dogs are being housed at the facility short-term and have not been added to the record of acquisition with the 
required information. Up to date records for dogs on hand can be important for animal health tracking purposes. Dogs 
acquired in the facility must be added to APHIS 7005 with the required information. 
***Correct by 11/9/2024. 
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Five dogs were observed to be overdue for maintaining unmatted hair coats (dog names Music, Laddy, Cherry, Goldi, and 
Viola). The licensee said that haircuts for dogs was programmed for this week, however the dogs had matted hair coats 
and need to be maintained free from matted hair coats. Matted hair can cause skin problems and discomfort in dogs. 
Ensure to groom affected dogs and adjust the routine of care to prevent matted hair coats. 
***Item was corrected prior to delivery of this report (affected dogs had been groomed and facility began to trim hair on 
additional unaffected dogs to prevent matting).

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
